result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Edwin Gatson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Edwin Gatson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis Edwin Gatson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Travis Edwin Gatson.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of SEVEN (7) YEARS, Concurrent Case 19CF930, with credit for 295 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is THREE (3) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is FOUR (4) YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, Concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 295 DAYS time served. 

AS TO COUNT  4:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to serve NINE (9) MONTHS in the House of Correction Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2, with credit for 295 DAYS time served.

Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, ONLY AFTER SERVING TWO (2) YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Provide DNA Sample.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; PreTrial Incarceration Credit; and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.

Defendant Travis Edwin Gatson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Travis Edwin Gatson.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1, COUNT 2 and COUNT4: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 3 and COUNT 4: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered  COUNT 3 and COUNT 4 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court ordered Defendant remanded until Sentencing hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Reserve Branch. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room 310 of the Safety Building. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.
